H-0195.1
HOUSE BILL 1027
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Jacobsen, Marshall, Burnett, and Couture
Prefiled 12/10/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Community Safety.
AN ACT Relating to housing of inmates in state correctional facilities; and adding a new section to chapter 72.09 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 72.09 RCW to read as follows:
An inmate may not be housed in a correctional facility that primarily houses persons of a different biological sex than that of the inmate if the inmate has previously been convicted of a sex offense as defined in RCW 9.94A.030 against a victim whose biological sex is the same as those persons who are primarily housed in that correctional facility.
--- END ---
1027.summary:
Purpose

The bill aims to regulate the housing of inmates in state correctional facilities based on biological sex. It specifically ensures that inmates who have been convicted of a sex offense cannot be housed in facilities that primarily house individuals of the opposite biological sex if their offense was against a victim of the same biological sex. This change is intended to enhance safety and address concerns surrounding inmate housing assignments.

Key Provisions

Inmate Housing Regulations

  • An inmate cannot be placed in a correctional facility that primarily accommodates individuals of a different biological sex if the inmate has a history of being convicted of a sex offense against a victim of the same biological sex.
